newsitem.title: GERMANY: Heidelberger Zement 1996 net profit rises.
newsitem.headline: Heidelberger Zement 1996 net profit rises.

text.p: German building materials group Heidelberger Zement AG said on Tuesday that its net profit for 1996 rose to 502 million marks versus 469 in the previous year.
The group also said its operating profit rose in 1996, to 650 million marks from 602 million a year ago.
Heidelberger said in a statement that positive turnover development and a reduction in income tax were the main contributing factors to its higher profits.
Turnover rose seven percent in 1996 to 6.5 billion marks, with the proportion of turnover from foreign activities rising to 60 percent of the total.
The firm said it planned to propose at higher divdidend for the year, raising the payout by 10 pfennigs to 1.60 marks for ordinary shares, with preference shares receiving 1.80 marks.
The dividend proposal will be presented at the firm's June 12 general meeting.
Heidelberger added that since March this year, it has owned a 50.01 percent stake in Belgium's SA Cimenteries, upping its holding from 48.9 percent prviosuly.
